alert.note: Alert for City of Richmond; Henrico (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 10 at 3:08PM EST until January 12 at 7:00AM EST by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Virginia... James River At Richmond Locks affecting City of Richmond and Henrico County. For the Lower James Basin...including Richmond Locks...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL FRIDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...James River at Richmond Locks. * WHEN...Until Friday morning. * IMPACTS...At 12.0 feet, Dock Street is closed between Pear Street and East Main Street...State Route 5. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:54 PM EST Wednesday the stage was 10.3 feet. - Bankfull stage is 8.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 2:54 PM EST Wednesday was 10.3 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise to 12.1 feet late tomorrow morning. It will then fall below flood stage early Friday morning to 4.6 feet Friday afternoon. - Flood stage is 8.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 12.1 feet on 09/19/2003. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 400 AM EST.
